page.title: 10Historic Buildings 1
page.content: Trefriw and Maenan have some interesting buildings with memorial inscriptions recently renovated by the Community Council. A plaque commemorates Dafydd Jones (Dewi Fardd) l708-88 who set up the first printing press in North Wales in his house opposite Trefriw church. A tombstone in Trefriw churchyard marks the grave of Evan Evans (Ieuan Glan Geirionydd) l795-l855,a l9th.C.Welsh poet and hymn writer.A plaque marks his birthplace at nearby Tan y Celyn. Maenan Abbey,now a hotel, was transferred from Conwy by Edward 1. After the Dissolution, stones and beams were incorporated from it into Gwydir Castle and local buildings and used to repair Caernarfon Castle. Prince Llewellyn had a summer palace at Trefriw, where he founded a church.
